references.paper_title: Retain: An interpretable predictive model for healthcare using reverse time attention mechanism
references.reason: This paper is foundational for the use of attention mechanisms in healthcare time series prediction, providing a basis for many subsequent works.

references.paper_title: Stagenet: Stage-aware neural networks for health risk prediction
references.reason: This paper introduces a novel approach to improve time series modeling by incorporating disease progression and sampling intervals, demonstrating better performance in patient health status prediction.

references.paper_title: Concare: Personalized clinical feature embedding via capturing the healthcare context
references.reason: This paper proposes a novel method to learn patient-specific representations by utilizing both variable-independent and variable-dependent encodings, improving prediction accuracy.

references.paper_title: Deep patient: an unsupervised representation to predict the future of patients from the electronic health records
references.reason: This paper introduces a deep learning model for representation learning using electronic health records and demonstrates the application to predict future patient outcomes.

This is a highly influential paper introducing the transformer architecture, which underpins many recent advancements in deep learning and has become a crucial component in various models for EHR analysis.
